1848class MOSAError(Exception):
1849    """@private
1850    This class defines exceptions raised by the MOSA algorithm.
1851    """
1852
1853    def __init__(self, message: str = "") -> None:
1854        """Class constructor."""
1855
1856        self._message = message
1857
1858    def __str__(self) -> str:
1859        """Returns the error message."""
1860
1861        return self._message
class Anneal: 
  12class Anneal:
  13    """This class implements the MOSA algorithm."""
  14
  15    def __init__(self) -> None:
  16        """@private
  17        Initializes object attributes.
  18        """
  19
  20        print("--------------------------------------------------")
  21        print("    MULTI-OBJECTIVE SIMULATED ANNEALING (MOSA)    ")
  22        print("--------------------------------------------------")
  23
  24        self._initemp: float = 1.0
  25        self._decrease: float = 0.9
  26        self._ntemp: int = 10
  27        self._population: dict = {}
  28        self._changemove: dict = {}
  29        self._swapmove: dict = {}
  30        self._insordelmove: dict = {}
  31        self._xnel: dict = {}
  32        self._maxnel: dict = {}
  33        self._xdistinct: dict = {}
  34        self._xstep: dict = {}
  35        self._xsort: dict = {}
  36        self._xselweight: dict = {}
  37        self._archive: dict = {}
  38        self._temp: list = []
  39        self._weight: list = []
  40        self._niter: int = 1000
  41        self._archive_file: str = "archive.json"
  42        self._archivesize: int = 1000
  43        self._maxarchivereject: int = 1000
  44        self._alpha: float = 0.0
  45        self._restart: bool = True
  46        self._trackoptprogress: bool = False
  47        self._f: list = []
  48        self._verbose: bool = False
  49
  50    def set_population(self, **groups) -> None:
  51        """
  52        Sets the population.
  53
  54        Parameters
  55        ----------
  56        `**groups`: series of key-value pairs where each key corresponds to a
  57        group in the solution and contains the data that can be used to achieve
  58        an optimized solution to the problem.
  59        """
  60
  61        if len(groups) > 0:
  62            for key, value in groups.items():
  63                self._population[key] = value
  64        else:
  65            raise MOSAError("No keyword was provided!")
  66
  67    def set_group_params(self, group: str, **params) -> None:
  68        """
  69        Sets the optimization parameters for the specified group in the solution.
  70
  71        Parameters
  72        ----------
  73        `group`: group in the solution.
  74
  75        `**params`: names of the optimization parameters with respective values.
  76
  77        They can be any of the alternatives below:
  78
  79        - `number_of_elements`
  80
  81        - `maximum_number_of_elements`
  82
  83        - `distinct_elements`
  84
  85        - `mc_step_size`
  86
  87        - `change_value_move`
  88
  89        - `insert_or_delete_move`
  90
  91        - `swap_move`
  92
  93        - `sort_elements`
  94
  95        - `group_selection_weights`
  96        """
  97
  98        allowed: dict
  99
 100        if len(params) > 0:
 101            allowed = {
 102                "number_of_elements": "self._xnel",
 103                "maximum_number_of_elements": "self._maxnel",
 104                "distinct_elements": "self._xdistinct",
 105                "mc_step_size": "self._xstep",
 106                "change_value_move": "self._changemove",
 107                "insert_or_delete_move": "self._insordelmove",
 108                "swap_move": "self._swapmove",
 109                "sort_elements": "self._xsort",
 110                "group_selection_weights": "self._xselweight",
 111            }
 112
 113            for param, value in params.items():
 114                if param in allowed:
 115                    exec(f"{allowed[param]}[group]=value")
 116        else:
 117            raise MOSAError("No keyword was provided!")
 118
 119    def set_opt_param(self, param: str, **groups) -> None:
 120        """
 121        Sets the values of the optimization parameter for the specified solution
 122        groups.
 123
 124        Parameters
 125        ----------
 126        `param`: name of the optimization parameter.
 127
 128        It must be one of the alternatives below:
 129
 130        - `number_of_elements`
 131
 132        - `maximum_number_of_elements`
 133
 134        - `distinct_elements`
 135
 136        - `mc_step_size`
 137
 138        - `change_value_move`
 139
 140        - `insert_or_delete_move`
 141
 142        - `swap_move`
 143
 144        - `sort_elements`
 145
 146        - `group_selection_weights`
 147
 148        `**groups`: series of key-value pairs where each key corresponds to a
 149        group in the solution to the problem.
 150        """
 151
 152        params: tuple
 153        execstr: str
 154
 155        if len(groups) > 0:
 156            params = {
 157                "number_of_elements": "self._xnel",
 158                "maximum_number_of_elements": "self._maxnel",
 159                "distinct_elements": "self._xdistinct",
 160                "mc_step_size": "self._xstep",
 161                "change_value_move": "self._changemove",
 162                "insert_or_delete_move": "self._insordelmove",
 163                "swap_move": "self._swapmove",
 164                "sort_elements": "self._xsort",
 165                "group_selection_weights": "self._xselweight",
 166            }
 167
 168            if param in params:
 169                execstr = "for key,value in groups.items():\n"
 170                execstr += f"    {params[param]}[key]=value"
 171                exec(execstr)
 172            else:
 173                raise MOSAError("Optimization parameter does not exist!")
 174        else:
 175            raise MOSAError("No keyword was provided!")
 176
 177    def evolve(self, func: object) -> None:
 178        """
 179        Performs the optimization of the objective function.
 180
 181        Parameters
 182        ----------
 183        `func`: objective function.
 184        """
 185
 186        print("--- BEGIN: Evolving a solution ---\n")
 187
 188        from_checkpoint: bool = False
 189        pmax: float = 0.0
 190        gamma: float = 1.0
 191        updated: int = 0
 192        nupdated: int = 0
 193        naccept: int = 0
 194        narchivereject: int = 0
 195        fcurr: list = []
 196        ftmp: list = []
 197        weight: list = []
 198        lstep: dict = {}
 199        population: dict = {}
 200        poptmp: dict = {}
 201        xcurr: dict = {}
 202        xtmp: dict = {}
 203        xstep: dict = {}
 204        xsampling: dict = {}
 205        xbounds: dict = {}
 206        changemove: dict = {}
 207        swapmove: dict = {}
 208        insordelmove: dict = {}
 209        xdistinct: dict = {}
 210        xnel: dict = {}
 211        maxnel: dict = {}
 212        xsort: dict = {}
 213        totlength: float = 0.0
 214        sellength: dict = {}
 215        groups: list = []
 216        args: str = ""
 217        MAX_FAILED: int = 10
 218        MIN_STEP_LENGTH: int = 10
 219
 220        self._temp = [self._initemp * self._decrease**i for i in range(self._ntemp)]
 221
 222        if self._restart:
 223            xcurr, fcurr, population = self.__getcheckpoint()
 224
 225            if not bool(self._archive):
 226                try:
 227                    print(
 228                        f"Trying to load the archive from file {self._archive_file}..."
 229                    )
 230
 231                    self._archive = json.load(open(self._archive_file, "r"))
 232                except FileNotFoundError:
 233                    print(
 234                        f"File {self._archive_file} not found! Initializing an empty archive..."
 235                    )
 236
 237                    self._archive = {"Solution": [], "Values": []}
 238
 239                print("Done!")
 240        else:
 241            print("Initializing an empty archive...")
 242
 243            self._archive = {"Solution": [], "Values": []}
 244
 245            print("Done!")
 246
 247        if bool(population) and bool(xcurr) and len(fcurr) > 0:
 248            if set(population.keys()) == set(xcurr.keys()):
 249                from_checkpoint = True
 250            else:
 251                raise MOSAError("Solution and population must have the same groups!")
 252        else:
 253            if bool(self._population):
 254                xcurr = {}
 255                fcurr = []
 256                population = deepcopy(self._population)
 257            else:
 258                raise MOSAError("A population must be provided!")
 259
 260        groups = list(population.keys())
 261
 262        print("------\n")
 263        print("Groups in the solution:\n======================\n")
 264
 265        for group in groups:
 266            print(f"    {group}:")
 267
 268            if group in self._xnel.keys() and self._xnel[group] > 0:
 269                xnel[group] = self._xnel[group]
 270            else:
 271                xnel[group] = 1
 272
 273            print(f"        Number of elements: {xnel[group]}")
 274
 275            if isinstance(population[group], tuple):
 276                print("        Sample space: continuous")
 277
 278                if len(population[group]) <= 1:
 279                    raise MOSAError(f"Two numbers are expected in group {group}!")
 280
 281                xsampling[group] = 1
 282                xbounds[group] = list(population[group])
 283
 284                if xbounds[group][1] < xbounds[group][0]:
 285                    xbounds[group][0], xbounds[group][1] = (
 286                        xbounds[group][1],
 287                        xbounds[group][0],
 288                    )
 289                elif xbounds[group][1] == xbounds[group][0]:
 290                    raise MOSAError(
 291                        f"Second element in group {group} must be larger than the first one!"
 292                    )
 293
 294                print(f"        Boundaries: ({xbounds[group][0]},{xbounds[group][1]})")
 295            elif isinstance(population[group], list):
 296                print("        Sample space: discrete")
 297                print(f"        Size of population group: {len(population[group])}")
 298
 299                if len(population[group]) <= 1 and not from_checkpoint:
 300                    raise MOSAError(
 301                        "Number of elements in the population group must be greater than one!"
 302                    )
 303
 304                xsampling[group] = 0
 305
 306                if group in self._xdistinct.keys():
 307                    xdistinct[group] = bool(self._xdistinct[group])
 308                else:
 309                    xdistinct[group] = False
 310
 311                print(f"        Distinct elements: {xdistinct[group]}")
 312            else:
 313                raise MOSAError(f"Wrong format of group {group}!")
 314
 315            if group in self._xselweight.keys():
 316                totlength += self._xselweight[group]
 317
 318                print(f"        Selection weight: {self._xselweight[group]}")
 319            else:
 320                totlength += 1.0
 321
 322                print("        Selection weight: 1.0")
 323
 324            sellength[group] = totlength
 325
 326            if group in self._changemove.keys() and self._changemove[group] >= 0.0:
 327                changemove[group] = float(self._changemove[group])
 328            else:
 329                changemove[group] = 1.0
 330
 331            if changemove[group] > 0.0:
 332                print(
 333                    f"        Weight of 'change value' trial move: {changemove[group]}"
 334                )
 335
 336            if group in self._swapmove.keys() and self._swapmove[group] > 0.0:
 337                swapmove[group] = float(self._swapmove[group])
 338
 339                print(f"        Weight of 'swap' trial move: {swapmove[group]}")
 340            else:
 341                swapmove[group] = 0.0
 342
 343            if group in self._insordelmove.keys() and self._insordelmove[group] > 0.0:
 344                insordelmove[group] = float(self._insordelmove[group])
 345
 346                print(
 347                    f"        Weight of 'insert or delete' trial move: {insordelmove[group]}"
 348                )
 349
 350                if group in self._maxnel.keys() and self._maxnel[group] >= xnel[group]:
 351                    maxnel[group] = int(self._maxnel[group])
 352
 353                    if maxnel[group] <= 1:
 354                        maxnel[group] = 2
 355                else:
 356                    maxnel[group] = inf
 357
 358                print(f"        Maximum number of elements: {maxnel[group]}")
 359            else:
 360                insordelmove[group] = 0.0
 361
 362            if swapmove[group] == 0.0 and group in self._xsort.keys():
 363                xsort[group] = bool(self._xsort[group])
 364            else:
 365                xsort[group] = False
 366
 367            print(f"        Sort values: {xsort[group]}")
 368
 369            if group in self._xstep.keys():
 370                if xsampling[group] == 1:
 371                    xstep[group] = float(self._xstep[group])
 372
 373                    if xstep[group] <= 0.0:
 374                        xstep[group] = 0.1
 375                else:
 376                    xstep[group] = int(self._xstep[group])
 377            else:
 378                if xsampling[group] == 1:
 379                    xstep[group] = 0.1
 380                else:
 381                    if changemove[group] > 0.0:
 382                        xstep[group] = int(len(population[group]) / 2)
 383                    else:
 384                        xstep[group] = 0
 385
 386            if xsampling[group] == 1:
 387                print(f"        Maximum step size: {xstep[group]}")
 388            elif (
 389                xsampling[group] == 0
 390                and (changemove[group] + insordelmove[group]) > 0.0
 391            ):
 392                if xstep[group] > len(population[group]) / 2 or xstep[group] <= 0:
 393                    xstep[group] = int(len(population[group]) / 2)
 394
 395                if xstep[group] >= MIN_STEP_LENGTH:
 396                    print(f"        Maximum step size: {xstep[group]}")
 397                else:
 398                    print("        Elements selected at random from the population")
 399
 400            if (
 401                xsampling[group] == 0
 402                and (changemove[group] + insordelmove[group]) > 0.0
 403            ):
 404                if len(population[group]) == 1:
 405                    lstep[group] = 0
 406                else:
 407                    lstep[group] = choice(len(population[group]))
 408
 409            if xnel[group] == 1 and insordelmove[group] == 0.0:
 410                changemove[group] = 1.0
 411                swapmove[group] = 0.0
 412
 413            if len(population[group]) == 0 and insordelmove[group] == 0:
 414                changemove[group] = 0.0
 415                swapmove[group] = 1.0
 416
 417        print("------")
 418
 419        if from_checkpoint:
 420            print("Initial solution loaded from the checkpoint file...")
 421        else:
 422            print("Initializing with a random solution from scratch...")
 423
 424            for group in groups:
 425                if xnel[group] == 1:
 426                    if xsampling[group] == 0:
 427                        m = choice(len(population[group]))
 428                        xcurr[group] = population[group][m]
 429
 430                        if xdistinct[group]:
 431                            population[group].pop(m)
 432                    else:
 433                        xcurr[group] = uniform(xbounds[group][0], xbounds[group][1])
 434                else:
 435                    xcurr[group] = []
 436
 437                    for j in range(xnel[group]):
 438                        if xsampling[group] == 0:
 439                            m = choice(len(population[group]))
 440                            xcurr[group].append(population[group][m])
 441
 442                            if xdistinct[group]:
 443                                population[group].pop(m)
 444                        else:
 445                            xcurr[group].append(
 446                                uniform(xbounds[group][0], xbounds[group][1])
 447                            )
 448
 449                    if xsort[group]:
 450                        xcurr[group].sort()
 451
 452            if callable(func):
 453                for group in groups:
 454                    args += f"{group} = {xcurr[group]}, "
 455
 456                fcurr = eval(f"list(func({args}))")
 457
 458                updated = self.__updatearchive(xcurr, fcurr)
 459
 460                if self._trackoptprogress:
 461                    if len(fcurr) == 1:
 462                        self._f.append(fcurr[0])
 463                    else:
 464                        self._f.append(fcurr)
 465            else:
 466                raise MOSAError("A Python function must be provided!")
 467
 468        print("Done!")
 469        print("------")
 470
 471        if len(fcurr) == len(self._weight):
 472            weight = self._weight.copy()
 473        else:
 474            weight = [1.0 for k in range(len(fcurr))]
 475
 476        if not self._verbose:
 477            print(f"Starting at temperature: {self._temp[0]:.6f}")
 478            print("Evolving solutions to the problem, please wait...")
 479
 480        for temp in self._temp:
 481            if self._verbose:
 482                print(f"TEMPERATURE: {temp:.6f}")
 483
 484            nupdated = 0
 485            naccept = 0
 486
 487            for j in range(self._niter):
 488                selstep = chosen = old = new = None
 489                xtmp = deepcopy(xcurr)
 490                poptmp = deepcopy(population)
 491
 492                r = uniform(0.0, totlength)
 493
 494                for group in groups:
 495                    if r < sellength[group]:
 496                        break
 497
 498                r = uniform(
 499                    0.0, (changemove[group] + swapmove[group] + insordelmove[group])
 500                )
 501
 502                if r < changemove[group] or r >= (changemove[group] + swapmove[group]):
 503                    if xnel[group] > 1:
 504                        old = choice(len(xtmp[group]))
 505
 506                    if xsampling[group] == 0 and len(poptmp[group]) > 0:
 507                        for _ in range(MAX_FAILED):
 508                            if len(poptmp[group]) == 1:
 509                                new = 0
 510                            elif xstep[group] >= MIN_STEP_LENGTH:
 511                                selstep = int(
 512                                    round(triangular(-xstep[group], 0, xstep[group]), 0)
 513                                )
 514                                new = lstep[group] + selstep
 515
 516                                if new >= len(poptmp[group]):
 517                                    new -= len(poptmp[group])
 518                                elif new < 0:
 519                                    new += len(poptmp[group])
 520                            else:
 521                                new = choice(len(poptmp[group]))
 522
 523                            if r >= changemove[group] or xdistinct[group]:
 524                                break
 525                            else:
 526                                if xnel[group] == 1:
 527                                    if not xtmp[group] == poptmp[group][new]:
 528                                        break
 529                                else:
 530                                    if not xtmp[group][old] == poptmp[group][new]:
 531                                        break
 532                        else:
 533                            new = None
 534
 535                if xsampling[group] == 0 and r < changemove[group] and new is None:
 536                    if insordelmove[group] > 0.0:
 537                        r = changemove[group] + swapmove[group]
 538                    elif swapmove[group] > 0.0 and xnel[group] > 1:
 539                        r = changemove[group]
 540                    else:
 541                        if self._verbose:
 542                            print(
 543                                f"WARNING!!!!!! It was not possible to find an element in group '{group}' in the population to update the solution at iteration {j}!"
 544                            )
 545
 546                        continue
 547
 548                if r < changemove[group]:
 549                    if xsampling[group] == 0:
 550                        if xdistinct[group]:
 551                            if xnel[group] == 1:
 552                                xtmp[group], poptmp[group][new] = (
 553                                    poptmp[group][new],
 554                                    xtmp[group],
 555                                )
 556                            else:
 557                                xtmp[group][old], poptmp[group][new] = (
 558                                    poptmp[group][new],
 559                                    xtmp[group][old],
 560                                )
 561                        else:
 562                            if xnel[group] == 1:
 563                                xtmp[group] = poptmp[group][new]
 564                            else:
 565                                xtmp[group][old] = poptmp[group][new]
 566                    else:
 567                        if xnel[group] == 1:
 568                            xtmp[group] += uniform(-xstep[group], xstep[group])
 569
 570                            if xtmp[group] > xbounds[group][1]:
 571                                xtmp[group] -= xbounds[group][1] - xbounds[group][0]
 572                            elif xtmp[group] < xbounds[group][0]:
 573                                xtmp[group] += xbounds[group][1] - xbounds[group][0]
 574                        else:
 575                            xtmp[group][old] += uniform(-xstep[group], xstep[group])
 576
 577                            if xtmp[group][old] > xbounds[group][1]:
 578                                xtmp[group][old] -= (
 579                                    xbounds[group][1] - xbounds[group][0]
 580                                )
 581                            elif xtmp[group][old] < xbounds[group][0]:
 582                                xtmp[group][old] += (
 583                                    xbounds[group][1] - xbounds[group][0]
 584                                )
 585
 586                    if xsort[group] and xnel[group] > 1:
 587                        xtmp[group].sort()
 588                elif r < (changemove[group] + swapmove[group]):
 589                    for _ in range(int(len(xtmp[group]) / 2)):
 590                        chosen = choice(len(xtmp[group]), 2, False)
 591
 592                        if not xtmp[group][chosen[0]] == xtmp[group][chosen[1]]:
 593                            xtmp[group][chosen[0]], xtmp[group][chosen[1]] = (
 594                                xtmp[group][chosen[1]],
 595                                xtmp[group][chosen[0]],
 596                            )
 597
 598                            break
 599                    else:
 600                        if self._verbose:
 601                            print(
 602                                f"WARNING!!!!!! Failed {int(len(xtmp[group])/2)} times to find different elements in group '{group}' for swapping at iteration {j}!"
 603                            )
 604
 605                        continue
 606                else:
 607                    if len(xtmp[group]) == 1:
 608                        r = 0.0
 609                    elif (xsampling[group] == 0 and len(poptmp[group]) == 0) or len(
 610                        xtmp[group]
 611                    ) >= maxnel[group]:
 612                        r = 1.0
 613                    else:
 614                        r = uniform(0.0, 1.0)
 615
 616                    if r < 0.5:
 617                        if xsampling[group] == 0:
 618                            xtmp[group].append(poptmp[group][new])
 619
 620                            if xdistinct[group]:
 621                                poptmp[group].pop(new)
 622                        else:
 623                            xtmp[group].append(
 624                                uniform(xbounds[group][0], xbounds[group][1])
 625                            )
 626
 627                        if xsort[group]:
 628                            xtmp[group].sort()
 629                    else:
 630                        if xsampling[group] == 0 and xdistinct[group]:
 631                            poptmp[group].append(xtmp[group][old])
 632
 633                        xtmp[group].pop(old)
 634
 635                gamma = 1.0
 636
 637                args = ""
 638
 639                for group in groups:
 640                    args += f"{group} = {xtmp[group]}, "
 641
 642                ftmp = eval(f"list(func({args}))")
 643
 644                for k in range(len(ftmp)):
 645                    if ftmp[k] < fcurr[k]:
 646                        pmax = p = 1.0
 647                    else:
 648                        p = exp(-(ftmp[k] - fcurr[k]) / (temp * weight[k]))
 649
 650                        if pmax < p:
 651                            pmax = p
 652
 653                    gamma *= p
 654
 655                gamma = (1.0 - self._alpha) * gamma + self._alpha * pmax
 656
 657                if gamma == 1.0 or uniform(0.0, 1.0) < gamma:
 658                    if xsampling[group] == 0 and new is not None:
 659                        lstep[group] = new
 660
 661                    fcurr = ftmp.copy()
 662                    xcurr = deepcopy(xtmp)
 663                    population = deepcopy(poptmp)
 664                    naccept += 1
 665                    updated = self.__updatearchive(xcurr, fcurr)
 666                    nupdated += updated
 667
 668                    if updated == 1:
 669                        narchivereject = 0
 670                    else:
 671                        narchivereject += 1
 672
 673                    self.__savecheckpoint(xcurr, fcurr, population)
 674                else:
 675                    narchivereject += 1
 676
 677                if self._trackoptprogress:
 678                    if len(fcurr) == 1:
 679                        self._f.append(fcurr[0])
 680                    else:
 681                        self._f.append(fcurr)
 682
 683                if narchivereject >= self._maxarchivereject:
 684                    if self._verbose:
 685                        print(
 686                            f"    Insertion in the archive consecutively rejected {self._maxarchivereject} times!"
 687                        )
 688                        print(f"    Stoping at iteration {j}...")
 689                    else:
 690                        print(
 691                            "Too many attempts to insert a solution in the archive failed!"
 692                        )
 693                        print(f"Stopping at temperature: {temp:.6f}")
 694
 695                    print("------")
 696                    print("\n--- THE END ---")
 697
 698                    self.savex()
 699
 700                    return
 701
 702            if self._verbose:
 703                if naccept > 0:
 704                    print(f"    Number of accepted moves: {naccept}.")
 705                    print(f"    Fraction of accepted moves: {naccept/self._niter:.6f}.")
 706
 707                    if nupdated > 0:
 708                        print(f"    Number of archive updates: {nupdated}.")
 709                        print(
 710                            f"    Fraction of archive updates in accepted moves: {nupdated/naccept:.6f}."
 711                        )
 712                    else:
 713                        print("    No archive update.")
 714                else:
 715                    print("    No move accepted.")
 716
 717                print("------")
 718
 719            if nupdated > 0:
 720                self.savex()
 721
 722        if not self._verbose:
 723            print("Maximum number of temperatures reached!")
 724            print(f"Stopping at temperature:  {temp:.6f}.")
 725            print("------")
 726
 727        print("\n--- THE END ---")
 728
 729    def prune_dominated(self, xset: dict = {}, del_duplicated: bool = False) -> dict:
 730        """
 731        Returns a subset of the full or reduced solution archive containing only
 732        non-dominated solutions.
 733
 734        Parameters
 735        ----------
 736        `xset`: full or reduced solution archive.
 737
 738        The default is {}, meaning the full solution archive.
 739
 740        `del_duplicated`: delete a solution if the objective values are strictly
 741        equal to the values of a previous solution.
 742
 743        The default is `False`.
 744
 745        Returns
 746        -------
 747        Solution archive with non-dominated solutions.
 748        """
 749
 750        tmpdict: dict = {}
 751        tmpdict["Solution"]: list = []
 752        tmpdict["Values"]: list = []
 753        nl: int
 754        ng: int
 755        ne: int
 756
 757        if not bool(xset):
 758            xset = self._archive
 759        else:
 760            if not ("Solution" in xset.keys() and "Values" in xset.keys()):
 761                raise MOSAError(
 762                    "'Solution' and 'Values' must be present in the dictionary!"
 763                )
 764            else:
 765                if not (
 766                    isinstance(xset["Solution"], list)
 767                    and isinstance(xset["Values"], list)
 768                ):
 769                    raise MOSAError("'Solution' and 'Values' must be Python lists!")
 770
 771        included: list = [True for i in range(len(xset["Values"]))]
 772
 773        for i in range(len(xset["Values"]) - 1):
 774            if not included[i]:
 775                continue
 776
 777            for j in range(i + 1, len(xset["Values"])):
 778                if not included[j]:
 779                    continue
 780
 781                nl = ng = ne = 0
 782
 783                for k in range(len(xset["Values"][i])):
 784                    if xset["Values"][i][k] < xset["Values"][j][k]:
 785                        nl += 1
 786                    elif xset["Values"][i][k] > xset["Values"][j][k]:
 787                        ng += 1
 788                    else:
 789                        ne += 1
 790
 791                if del_duplicated and ne == len(xset["Values"][i]):
 792                    included[j] = False
 793                elif nl > 0 and ng == 0:
 794                    included[j] = False
 795                elif ng > 0 and nl == 0:
 796                    included[i] = False
 797
 798                    break
 799
 800        for i in range(len(xset["Values"])):
 801            if included[i]:
 802                tmpdict["Solution"].append(xset["Solution"][i])
 803                tmpdict["Values"].append(xset["Values"][i])
 804
 805        return tmpdict
 806
 807    def savex(self, xset: dict = {}, archive_file: str = "") -> None:
 808        """
 809        Saves the solution archive into a text file in JSON format.
 810
 811        Parameters
 812        ----------
 813        `xset`: full or reduced solution archive.
 814
 815        The default is {}, meaning the full solution archive.
 816
 817        `archive_file`: name of the archive file.
 818
 819        The default is an empty string, which means the main archive file.
 820        """
 821
 822        if isinstance(xset, dict):
 823            if not bool(xset):
 824                xset = self._archive
 825        else:
 826            raise MOSAError("The solution archive must be provided as a dictionary!")
 827
 828        if isinstance(archive_file, str):
 829            archive_file = archive_file.strip()
 830
 831            if len(archive_file) == 0:
 832                archive_file = self._archive_file
 833        else:
 834            raise MOSAError("The name of the archive file must be a string!")
 835
 836        json.dump(xset, open(archive_file, "w"), indent=4)
 837
 838    def loadx(self, archive_file: str = "") -> None:
 839        """
 840        Loads solutions from a JSON file into the solution archive.
 841
 842        Parameters
 843        ----------
 844        `archive_file`: name of the archive file.
 845
 846        The default is an empty string, which means the main archive file will
 847        be used.
 848        """
 849
 850        if isinstance(archive_file, str):
 851            archive_file = archive_file.strip()
 852
 853            if len(archive_file) == 0:
 854                archive_file = self._archive_file
 855        else:
 856            raise MOSAError("Name of the archive file must be a string!")
 857
 858        try:
 859            tmpdict = json.load(open(archive_file, "r"))
 860        except FileNotFoundError:
 861            print(f"WARNING: File {archive_file} not found!")
 862
 863            return
 864        except:
 865            print(f"WARNING: Something wrong with file {archive_file}!")
 866
 867            return
 868
 869        self._archive = tmpdict
 870
 871    def trimx(self, xset: dict = {}, thresholds: tuple | list = []) -> dict:
 872        """
 873        Extracts solutions where the objective values are less than or equal to
 874        the thresholds.
 875
 876        Parameters
 877        ----------
 878        `xset`: full or reduced solution archive.
 879
 880        The default is {}, meaning the full solution archive.
 881
 882        `thresholds`: maximum values of the objective functions.
 883
 884        The default is an empty list.
 885
 886        Returns
 887        -------
 888        Solution archive with only the selected solutions.
 889        """
 890
 891        tmpdict: dict = {}
 892        tmpdict["Solution"]: list = []
 893        tmpdict["Values"]: list = []
 894        included: bool
 895
 896        if not bool(xset):
 897            xset = self._archive
 898        else:
 899            if not ("Solution" in xset.keys() and "Values" in xset.keys()):
 900                raise MOSAError(
 901                    "'Solution' and 'Values' must be present in the dictionary!"
 902                )
 903            else:
 904                if not (
 905                    isinstance(xset["Solution"], list)
 906                    and isinstance(xset["Values"], list)
 907                ):
 908                    raise MOSAError("'Solution' and 'Values' must be Python lists!")
 909
 910        indexlist = list(range(len(xset["Values"])))
 911
 912        if len(thresholds) == len(xset["Values"][0]):
 913            for i in indexlist:
 914                for j in range(len(xset["Values"][i])):
 915                    if thresholds[j] is None or xset["Values"][i][j] <= thresholds[j]:
 916                        included = True
 917                    else:
 918                        included = False
 919
 920                        break
 921
 922                if included:
 923                    tmpdict["Solution"].append(xset["Solution"][i])
 924                    tmpdict["Values"].append(xset["Values"][i])
 925        else:
 926            raise MOSAError("The threshold list cannot be empty!")
 927
 928        return tmpdict
 929
 930    def reducex(self, xset: dict = {}, index: int = 0, nel: int = 5) -> dict:
 931        """
 932        Reduces and sorts in ascending order the archive according to the selected
 933        objective function.
 934
 935        Parameters
 936        ----------
 937        `xset`: full or reduced solution archive. The default is {}, meaning the
 938        full solution archive.
 939
 940        `index`: index of the objective function.
 941
 942        The default is 0.
 943
 944        `nel`: number of solutions stored in the reduced solution archive.
 945
 946        The default is 5.
 947
 948        Returns
 949        -------
 950        Reduced solution archive.
 951        """
 952
 953        tmpdict: dict = {}
 954        tmpdict["Solution"]: list = []
 955        tmpdict["Values"]: list = []
 956
 957        if not bool(xset):
 958            xset = self._archive
 959        else:
 960            if not ("Solution" in xset.keys() and "Values" in xset.keys()):
 961                raise MOSAError(
 962                    "'Solution' and 'Values' must be present in the dictionary!"
 963                )
 964            else:
 965                if not (
 966                    isinstance(xset["Solution"], list)
 967                    and isinstance(xset["Values"], list)
 968                ):
 969                    raise MOSAError("'Solution' and 'Values' must be Python lists!")
 970
 971        if nel > len(xset["Values"]):
 972            nel = len(xset["Values"])
 973
 974        indexlist = list(range(len(xset["Values"])))
 975
 976        for i in range(nel):
 977            k = 0
 978
 979            for j in indexlist:
 980                if k == 0:
 981                    toadd = j
 982                    bestval = xset["Values"][j][index]
 983                    k += 1
 984                else:
 985                    if xset["Values"][j][index] < bestval:
 986                        toadd = j
 987                        bestval = xset["Values"][j][index]
 988
 989            tmpdict["Solution"].append(xset["Solution"][toadd])
 990            tmpdict["Values"].append(xset["Values"][toadd])
 991            indexlist.remove(toadd)
 992
 993        return tmpdict
 994
 995    def mergex(self, xset_list: list) -> dict:
 996        """
 997        Merges a list of solution archives into a single solution archive.
 998
 999        Parameters
1000        ----------
1001        `xset_list`: solution archives to be merged.
1002
1003        Returns
1004        -------
1005        Merged solution archives.
1006        """
1007
1008        tmpdict: dict = {}
1009
1010        if len(xset_list) <= 1:
1011            raise MOSAError("Nothing to be done!")
1012
1013        if not bool(xset_list[0]):
1014            raise MOSAError("First solution archive is empty!")
1015        else:
1016            if not (
1017                "Solution" in xset_list[0].keys() and "Values" in xset_list[0].keys()
1018            ):
1019                raise MOSAError(
1020                    "'Solution' and 'Values' must be present in the dictionary!"
1021                )
1022            else:
1023                if not (
1024                    isinstance(xset_list[0]["Solution"], list)
1025                    and isinstance(xset_list[0]["Values"], list)
1026                ):
1027                    raise MOSAError("'Solution' and 'Values' must be Python lists!")
1028
1029                tmpdict = deepcopy(xset_list[0])
1030
1031        for i in range(1, len(xset_list)):
1032            if (
1033                bool(xset_list[i])
1034                and "Solution" in xset_list[i].keys()
1035                and "Values" in xset_list[i].keys()
1036                and isinstance(xset_list[i]["Solution"], list)
1037                and isinstance(xset_list[i]["Values"], list)
1038            ):
1039                for j in range(len(xset_list[i]["Values"])):
1040                    tmpdict["Solution"].append(xset_list[i]["Solution"][j])
1041                    tmpdict["Values"].append(xset_list[i]["Values"][j])
1042            else:
1043                raise MOSAError("Format of solution archive is wrong!")
1044
1045        return tmpdict
1046
1047    def copyx(self, xset: dict = {}) -> dict:
1048        """
1049        Returns a copy of the solution archive.
1050
1051        Parameters
1052        ----------
1053        `xset`: full or reduced solution archive.
1054
1055        The default is {}, meaning the full solution archive.
1056
1057        Returns
1058        -------
1059        Copy of the solution archive.
1060        """
1061
1062        if not bool(xset):
1063            xset = self._archive
1064        else:
1065            if not ("Solution" in xset.keys() and "Values" in xset.keys()):
1066                raise MOSAError(
1067                    "'Solution' and 'Values' must be present in the dictionary!"
1068                )
1069            else:
1070                if not (
1071                    isinstance(xset["Solution"], list)
1072                    and isinstance(xset["Values"], list)
1073                ):
1074                    raise MOSAError("'Solution' and 'Values' must be Python lists!")
1075
1076        return deepcopy(xset)

1115    # TODO: Show up to three objective functions in a single plot
1116    def plot_front(
1117        self, xset: dict = {}, index1: int = 0, index2: int = 1, file: str | None = None
1118    ) -> None:
1119        """
1120        Plots 2D scatter plots of selected pairs of objective values.
1121
1122        Parameters
1123        ----------
1124        `xset`: full or reduced solution archive.
1125
1126        The default is {}, meaning the full solution archive.
1127
1128        `index1`: index of the objective function displayed along x-axis.
1129
1130        The default is 0.
1131
1132        `index2`: index of the objective function displayed along y-axis.
1133
1134        The default is 1.
1135
1136        `file`: name of the image file where the plot will be saved.
1137
1138        The default is `None`, which means that no figure will be created.
1139        """
1140
1141        try:
1142            import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
1143        except:
1144            raise MOSAError("Matplotlib is not available in your system!")
1145
1146        f: list = [[], []]
1147
1148        if not bool(xset):
1149            xset = self._archive
1150        else:
1151            if not ("Solution" in xset.keys() and "Values" in xset.keys()):
1152                raise MOSAError(
1153                    "'Solution' and 'Values' must be present in the dictionary!"
1154                )
1155            else:
1156                if not (
1157                    isinstance(xset["Solution"], list)
1158                    and isinstance(xset["Values"], list)
1159                ):
1160                    raise MOSAError("'Solution' and 'Values' must be Python lists!")
1161
1162        if (
1163            index1 >= 0
1164            and index1 < len(xset["Values"][0])
1165            and index2 >= 0
1166            and index2 < len(xset["Values"][0])
1167        ):
1168            for i in range(len(xset["Values"])):
1169                f[0].append(xset["Values"][i][index1])
1170                f[1].append(xset["Values"][i][index2])
1171
1172            plt.xlabel(f"f{index1}")
1173            plt.ylabel(f"f{index2}")
1174            plt.grid()
1175            plt.scatter(f[0], f[1])
1176
1177            if file is not None and len(file) > 0:
1178                plt.savefig(file)
1179
1180            plt.show()
1181        else:
1182            raise MOSAError("Index out of range!")

1184    # TODO: Use numpy functions and compute also the standard deviation
1185    def print_stats(self, xset: dict = {}) -> None:
1186        """
1187        Prints the minimum, maximum and average values of the objectives.
1188
1189        Parameters
1190        ----------
1191        `xset`: full or reduced solution archive.
1192
1193        The default is {}, meaning the full solution archive.
1194        """
1195
1196        if not bool(xset):
1197            xset = self._archive
1198        else:
1199            if not ("Solution" in xset.keys() and "Values" in xset.keys()):
1200                raise MOSAError(
1201                    "'Solution' and 'Values' must be present in the dictionary!"
1202                )
1203            else:
1204                if not (
1205                    isinstance(xset["Solution"], list)
1206                    and isinstance(xset["Values"], list)
1207                ):
1208                    raise MOSAError("'Solution' and 'Values' must be Python lists!")
1209
1210        fmin: list = []
1211        fmax: list = []
1212        favg: list = []
1213
1214        for i in range(len(xset["Values"])):
1215            for j in range(len(xset["Values"][i])):
1216                if i == 0:
1217                    fmin.append(xset["Values"][i][j])
1218                    fmax.append(xset["Values"][i][j])
1219                    favg.append(xset["Values"][i][j])
1220                else:
1221                    if xset["Values"][i][j] < fmin[j]:
1222                        fmin[j] = xset["Values"][i][j]
1223                    elif xset["Values"][i][j] > fmax[j]:
1224                        fmax[j] = xset["Values"][i][j]
1225
1226                    favg[j] += xset["Values"][i][j]
1227
1228                    if i == len(xset["Values"]) - 1:
1229                        print("===")
1230                        print("Objective function %d: " % j)
1231                        print("    Minimum: %f" % fmin[j])
1232                        print("    Maximum: %f" % fmax[j])
1233                        print("    Average: %f" % (favg[j] / (i + 1)))
1234
1235    def __updatearchive(self, x: dict, f: list) -> int:
1236        """
1237        Checks if this solution is better than solutions already in the archive.
1238        If so, the archive is updated, this solution is appended and a worse solution
1239        is removed.
1240
1241        Parameters
1242        ----------
1243        `x`: solution.
1244
1245        `f`: objective values.
1246
1247        Returns
1248        -------
1249        1, if the archive is updated, or 0, if not.
1250        """
1251
1252        updated: int = 0
1253        indexlist = list(range(len(self._archive["Values"])))
1254
1255        for i in indexlist:
1256            if f == self._archive["Values"][i]:
1257                return updated
1258
1259        if len(self._archive["Solution"]) == 0:
1260            updated = 1
1261        else:
1262            shuffle(indexlist)
1263
1264            for i in indexlist:
1265                nl = ng = 0
1266
1267                for j in range(len(self._archive["Values"][i])):
1268                    if f[j] < self._archive["Values"][i][j]:
1269                        nl += 1
1270                    elif f[j] > self._archive["Values"][i][j]:
1271                        ng += 1
1272
1273                if len(self._archive["Solution"]) < self._archivesize:
1274                    if nl > 0:
1275                        updated = 1
1276
1277                        if ng == 0:
1278                            self._archive["Solution"].pop(i)
1279                            self._archive["Values"].pop(i)
1280
1281                            break
1282                    else:
1283                        updated = 0
1284
1285                        break
1286                else:
1287                    if nl > 0 and ng == 0:
1288                        self._archive["Solution"].pop(i)
1289                        self._archive["Values"].pop(i)
1290
1291                        updated = 1
1292
1293                        break
1294
1295        if updated == 1:
1296            self._archive["Solution"].append(x)
1297            self._archive["Values"].append(f)
1298
1299        return updated
1300
1301    def __getcheckpoint(self) -> tuple:
1302        """
1303        Initializes with a solution from a previous run.
1304
1305        Returns
1306        -------
1307        Solution, objective values, and population compatible with the solution.
1308        """
1309
1310        tmpdict: dict = {}
1311        x: dict = {}
1312        f: list = []
1313        population: dict = {}
1314
1315        print("Looking for a solution in the checkpoint file...")
1316
1317        try:
1318            tmpdict = json.load(open("checkpoint.json", "r"))
1319
1320            if (
1321                "Solution" in tmpdict.keys()
1322                and "Values" in tmpdict.keys()
1323                and "Population" in tmpdict.keys()
1324            ):
1325                x = tmpdict["Solution"]
1326                f = tmpdict["Values"]
1327                population = tmpdict["Population"]
1328
1329                if "SampleSpace" in tmpdict.keys():
1330                    ss = tmpdict["SampleSpace"]
1331
1332                    for key in ss.keys():
1333                        if ss[key] == 1:
1334                            population[key] = tuple(population[key])
1335        except:
1336            print("No checkpoint file!")
1337
1338        print("Done!")
1339
1340        return x, f, population
1341
1342    def __savecheckpoint(self, x: dict, f: list, population: dict) -> None:
1343        """
1344        Saves the solution passed as argument as JSON into a text file.
1345
1346        Parameters
1347        ----------
1348        `x`: solution.
1349
1350        `f`: objective values.
1351
1352        `population`: population compatible with the solution.
1353        """
1354
1355        tmpdict: dict = {
1356            "Solution": x,
1357            "Values": f,
1358            "Population": population,
1359            "SampleSpace": {},
1360        }
1361
1362        for key in population.keys():
1363            if isinstance(population[key], list):
1364                tmpdict["SampleSpace"][key] = 0
1365            elif isinstance(population[key], tuple):
1366                tmpdict["SampleSpace"][key] = 1
1367
1368        json.dump(tmpdict, open("checkpoint.json", "w"), indent=4)

1688    @property
1689    def change_value_move(self) -> dict:
1690        """
1691        Weight (non-normalized probability) to select a trial move where the value
1692        of a randomly selected element in a group in the solution will be modified
1693        as follows:
1694
1695        - Discrete search space: values between the solution and the population
1696        are exchanged.
1697
1698        - Continuous search space: the value of the solution element is randomly
1699        incremented/decremented.
1700
1701        The default is {}, which means the weight to select this trial move is
1702        equal to 1.0.
1703        """
1704
1705        return self._changemove
1706
1707    @change_value_move.setter
1708    def change_value_move(self, val: dict) -> None:
1709        if isinstance(val, dict):
1710            for key, value in val.items():
1711                if isinstance(value, (float, int)) and value >= 0.0:
1712                    self._changemove[key] = value
1713                else:
1714                    raise MOSAError(f"Group '{key}' must be a positive number!")
1715        else:
1716            raise MOSAError("Weights of trial moves must be provided as a dictionary!")

1805            raise MOSAError("Group selection weights must be provided as a dictionary!")
1806
1807    @property
1808    def track_optimization_progress(self) -> bool:
1809        """
1810        Tracks the optimization progress by saving the accepted objetive values
1811        into a Python list.
1812
1813        The default is `False`.
1814        """
1815
1816        return self._trackoptprogress
1817
1818    @track_optimization_progress.setter
1819    def track_optimization_progress(self, val: bool) -> None:
1820        if isinstance(val, bool):
1821            self._trackoptprogress = val
1822        else:
1823            raise MOSAError("Tracking or not optimization progress must be a boolean!")
1824
1825    @property
1826    def accepted_objective_values(self) -> list:
1827        """Accepted objective values over Monte Carlo iterations."""
1828
1829        return self._f
1830
1831    @property
1832    def verbose(self) -> bool:
1833        """
1834        Displays verbose output.
1835
1836        The default is `False`.
1837        """
1838
1839        return self._verbose
1840
1841    @verbose.setter
1842    def verbose(self, val: bool) -> None:
1843        if isinstance(val, bool):
1844            self._verbose = val
1845        else:
1846            raise MOSAError("Displaying or not verbose output must be a boolean!")

This class implements the MOSA algorithm.

def evolve(self, func: object) -> None: 
177    def evolve(self, func: object) -> None:
178        """
179        Performs the optimization of the objective function.
180
181        Parameters
182        ----------
183        `func`: objective function.
184        """
185
186        print("--- BEGIN: Evolving a solution ---\n")
187
188        from_checkpoint: bool = False
189        pmax: float = 0.0
190        gamma: float = 1.0
191        updated: int = 0
192        nupdated: int = 0
193        naccept: int = 0
194        narchivereject: int = 0
195        fcurr: list = []
196        ftmp: list = []
197        weight: list = []
198        lstep: dict = {}
199        population: dict = {}
200        poptmp: dict = {}
201        xcurr: dict = {}
202        xtmp: dict = {}
203        xstep: dict = {}
204        xsampling: dict = {}
205        xbounds: dict = {}
206        changemove: dict = {}
207        swapmove: dict = {}
208        insordelmove: dict = {}
209        xdistinct: dict = {}
210        xnel: dict = {}
211        maxnel: dict = {}
212        xsort: dict = {}
213        totlength: float = 0.0
214        sellength: dict = {}
215        groups: list = []
216        args: str = ""
217        MAX_FAILED: int = 10
218        MIN_STEP_LENGTH: int = 10
219
220        self._temp = [self._initemp * self._decrease**i for i in range(self._ntemp)]
221
222        if self._restart:
223            xcurr, fcurr, population = self.__getcheckpoint()
224
225            if not bool(self._archive):
226                try:
227                    print(
228                        f"Trying to load the archive from file {self._archive_file}..."
229                    )
230
231                    self._archive = json.load(open(self._archive_file, "r"))
232                except FileNotFoundError:
233                    print(
234                        f"File {self._archive_file} not found! Initializing an empty archive..."
235                    )
236
237                    self._archive = {"Solution": [], "Values": []}
238
239                print("Done!")
240        else:
241            print("Initializing an empty archive...")
242
243            self._archive = {"Solution": [], "Values": []}
244
245            print("Done!")
246
247        if bool(population) and bool(xcurr) and len(fcurr) > 0:
248            if set(population.keys()) == set(xcurr.keys()):
249                from_checkpoint = True
250            else:
251                raise MOSAError("Solution and population must have the same groups!")
252        else:
253            if bool(self._population):
254                xcurr = {}
255                fcurr = []
256                population = deepcopy(self._population)
257            else:
258                raise MOSAError("A population must be provided!")
259
260        groups = list(population.keys())
261
262        print("------\n")
263        print("Groups in the solution:\n======================\n")
264
265        for group in groups:
266            print(f"    {group}:")
267
268            if group in self._xnel.keys() and self._xnel[group] > 0:
269                xnel[group] = self._xnel[group]
270            else:
271                xnel[group] = 1
272
273            print(f"        Number of elements: {xnel[group]}")
274
275            if isinstance(population[group], tuple):
276                print("        Sample space: continuous")
277
278                if len(population[group]) <= 1:
279                    raise MOSAError(f"Two numbers are expected in group {group}!")
280
281                xsampling[group] = 1
282                xbounds[group] = list(population[group])
283
284                if xbounds[group][1] < xbounds[group][0]:
285                    xbounds[group][0], xbounds[group][1] = (
286                        xbounds[group][1],
287                        xbounds[group][0],
288                    )
289                elif xbounds[group][1] == xbounds[group][0]:
290                    raise MOSAError(
291                        f"Second element in group {group} must be larger than the first one!"
292                    )
293
294                print(f"        Boundaries: ({xbounds[group][0]},{xbounds[group][1]})")
295            elif isinstance(population[group], list):
296                print("        Sample space: discrete")
297                print(f"        Size of population group: {len(population[group])}")
298
299                if len(population[group]) <= 1 and not from_checkpoint:
300                    raise MOSAError(
301                        "Number of elements in the population group must be greater than one!"
302                    )
303
304                xsampling[group] = 0
305
306                if group in self._xdistinct.keys():
307                    xdistinct[group] = bool(self._xdistinct[group])
308                else:
309                    xdistinct[group] = False
310
311                print(f"        Distinct elements: {xdistinct[group]}")
312            else:
313                raise MOSAError(f"Wrong format of group {group}!")
314
315            if group in self._xselweight.keys():
316                totlength += self._xselweight[group]
317
318                print(f"        Selection weight: {self._xselweight[group]}")
319            else:
320                totlength += 1.0
321
322                print("        Selection weight: 1.0")
323
324            sellength[group] = totlength
325
326            if group in self._changemove.keys() and self._changemove[group] >= 0.0:
327                changemove[group] = float(self._changemove[group])
328            else:
329                changemove[group] = 1.0
330
331            if changemove[group] > 0.0:
332                print(
333                    f"        Weight of 'change value' trial move: {changemove[group]}"
334                )
335
336            if group in self._swapmove.keys() and self._swapmove[group] > 0.0:
337                swapmove[group] = float(self._swapmove[group])
338
339                print(f"        Weight of 'swap' trial move: {swapmove[group]}")
340            else:
341                swapmove[group] = 0.0
342
343            if group in self._insordelmove.keys() and self._insordelmove[group] > 0.0:
344                insordelmove[group] = float(self._insordelmove[group])
345
346                print(
347                    f"        Weight of 'insert or delete' trial move: {insordelmove[group]}"
348                )
349
350                if group in self._maxnel.keys() and self._maxnel[group] >= xnel[group]:
351                    maxnel[group] = int(self._maxnel[group])
352
353                    if maxnel[group] <= 1:
354                        maxnel[group] = 2
355                else:
356                    maxnel[group] = inf
357
358                print(f"        Maximum number of elements: {maxnel[group]}")
359            else:
360                insordelmove[group] = 0.0
361
362            if swapmove[group] == 0.0 and group in self._xsort.keys():
363                xsort[group] = bool(self._xsort[group])
364            else:
365                xsort[group] = False
366
367            print(f"        Sort values: {xsort[group]}")
368
369            if group in self._xstep.keys():
370                if xsampling[group] == 1:
371                    xstep[group] = float(self._xstep[group])
372
373                    if xstep[group] <= 0.0:
374                        xstep[group] = 0.1
375                else:
376                    xstep[group] = int(self._xstep[group])
377            else:
378                if xsampling[group] == 1:
379                    xstep[group] = 0.1
380                else:
381                    if changemove[group] > 0.0:
382                        xstep[group] = int(len(population[group]) / 2)
383                    else:
384                        xstep[group] = 0
385
386            if xsampling[group] == 1:
387                print(f"        Maximum step size: {xstep[group]}")
388            elif (
389                xsampling[group] == 0
390                and (changemove[group] + insordelmove[group]) > 0.0
391            ):
392                if xstep[group] > len(population[group]) / 2 or xstep[group] <= 0:
393                    xstep[group] = int(len(population[group]) / 2)
394
395                if xstep[group] >= MIN_STEP_LENGTH:
396                    print(f"        Maximum step size: {xstep[group]}")
397                else:
398                    print("        Elements selected at random from the population")
399
400            if (
401                xsampling[group] == 0
402                and (changemove[group] + insordelmove[group]) > 0.0
403            ):
404                if len(population[group]) == 1:
405                    lstep[group] = 0
406                else:
407                    lstep[group] = choice(len(population[group]))
408
409            if xnel[group] == 1 and insordelmove[group] == 0.0:
410                changemove[group] = 1.0
411                swapmove[group] = 0.0
412
413            if len(population[group]) == 0 and insordelmove[group] == 0:
414                changemove[group] = 0.0
415                swapmove[group] = 1.0
416
417        print("------")
418
419        if from_checkpoint:
420            print("Initial solution loaded from the checkpoint file...")
421        else:
422            print("Initializing with a random solution from scratch...")
423
424            for group in groups:
425                if xnel[group] == 1:
426                    if xsampling[group] == 0:
427                        m = choice(len(population[group]))
428                        xcurr[group] = population[group][m]
429
430                        if xdistinct[group]:
431                            population[group].pop(m)
432                    else:
433                        xcurr[group] = uniform(xbounds[group][0], xbounds[group][1])
434                else:
435                    xcurr[group] = []
436
437                    for j in range(xnel[group]):
438                        if xsampling[group] == 0:
439                            m = choice(len(population[group]))
440                            xcurr[group].append(population[group][m])
441
442                            if xdistinct[group]:
443                                population[group].pop(m)
444                        else:
445                            xcurr[group].append(
446                                uniform(xbounds[group][0], xbounds[group][1])
447                            )
448
449                    if xsort[group]:
450                        xcurr[group].sort()
451
452            if callable(func):
453                for group in groups:
454                    args += f"{group} = {xcurr[group]}, "
455
456                fcurr = eval(f"list(func({args}))")
457
458                updated = self.__updatearchive(xcurr, fcurr)
459
460                if self._trackoptprogress:
461                    if len(fcurr) == 1:
462                        self._f.append(fcurr[0])
463                    else:
464                        self._f.append(fcurr)
465            else:
466                raise MOSAError("A Python function must be provided!")
467
468        print("Done!")
469        print("------")
470
471        if len(fcurr) == len(self._weight):
472            weight = self._weight.copy()
473        else:
474            weight = [1.0 for k in range(len(fcurr))]
475
476        if not self._verbose:
477            print(f"Starting at temperature: {self._temp[0]:.6f}")
478            print("Evolving solutions to the problem, please wait...")
479
480        for temp in self._temp:
481            if self._verbose:
482                print(f"TEMPERATURE: {temp:.6f}")
483
484            nupdated = 0
485            naccept = 0
486
487            for j in range(self._niter):
488                selstep = chosen = old = new = None
489                xtmp = deepcopy(xcurr)
490                poptmp = deepcopy(population)
491
492                r = uniform(0.0, totlength)
493
494                for group in groups:
495                    if r < sellength[group]:
496                        break
497
498                r = uniform(
499                    0.0, (changemove[group] + swapmove[group] + insordelmove[group])
500                )
501
502                if r < changemove[group] or r >= (changemove[group] + swapmove[group]):
503                    if xnel[group] > 1:
504                        old = choice(len(xtmp[group]))
505
506                    if xsampling[group] == 0 and len(poptmp[group]) > 0:
507                        for _ in range(MAX_FAILED):
508                            if len(poptmp[group]) == 1:
509                                new = 0
510                            elif xstep[group] >= MIN_STEP_LENGTH:
511                                selstep = int(
512                                    round(triangular(-xstep[group], 0, xstep[group]), 0)
513                                )
514                                new = lstep[group] + selstep
515
516                                if new >= len(poptmp[group]):
517                                    new -= len(poptmp[group])
518                                elif new < 0:
519                                    new += len(poptmp[group])
520                            else:
521                                new = choice(len(poptmp[group]))
522
523                            if r >= changemove[group] or xdistinct[group]:
524                                break
525                            else:
526                                if xnel[group] == 1:
527                                    if not xtmp[group] == poptmp[group][new]:
528                                        break
529                                else:
530                                    if not xtmp[group][old] == poptmp[group][new]:
531                                        break
532                        else:
533                            new = None
534
535                if xsampling[group] == 0 and r < changemove[group] and new is None:
536                    if insordelmove[group] > 0.0:
537                        r = changemove[group] + swapmove[group]
538                    elif swapmove[group] > 0.0 and xnel[group] > 1:
539                        r = changemove[group]
540                    else:
541                        if self._verbose:
542                            print(
543                                f"WARNING!!!!!! It was not possible to find an element in group '{group}' in the population to update the solution at iteration {j}!"
544                            )
545
546                        continue
547
548                if r < changemove[group]:
549                    if xsampling[group] == 0:
550                        if xdistinct[group]:
551                            if xnel[group] == 1:
552                                xtmp[group], poptmp[group][new] = (
553                                    poptmp[group][new],
554                                    xtmp[group],
555                                )
556                            else:
557                                xtmp[group][old], poptmp[group][new] = (
558                                    poptmp[group][new],
559                                    xtmp[group][old],
560                                )
561                        else:
562                            if xnel[group] == 1:
563                                xtmp[group] = poptmp[group][new]
564                            else:
565                                xtmp[group][old] = poptmp[group][new]
566                    else:
567                        if xnel[group] == 1:
568                            xtmp[group] += uniform(-xstep[group], xstep[group])
569
570                            if xtmp[group] > xbounds[group][1]:
571                                xtmp[group] -= xbounds[group][1] - xbounds[group][0]
572                            elif xtmp[group] < xbounds[group][0]:
573                                xtmp[group] += xbounds[group][1] - xbounds[group][0]
574                        else:
575                            xtmp[group][old] += uniform(-xstep[group], xstep[group])
576
577                            if xtmp[group][old] > xbounds[group][1]:
578                                xtmp[group][old] -= (
579                                    xbounds[group][1] - xbounds[group][0]
580                                )
581                            elif xtmp[group][old] < xbounds[group][0]:
582                                xtmp[group][old] += (
583                                    xbounds[group][1] - xbounds[group][0]
584                                )
585
586                    if xsort[group] and xnel[group] > 1:
587                        xtmp[group].sort()
588                elif r < (changemove[group] + swapmove[group]):
589                    for _ in range(int(len(xtmp[group]) / 2)):
590                        chosen = choice(len(xtmp[group]), 2, False)
591
592                        if not xtmp[group][chosen[0]] == xtmp[group][chosen[1]]:
593                            xtmp[group][chosen[0]], xtmp[group][chosen[1]] = (
594                                xtmp[group][chosen[1]],
595                                xtmp[group][chosen[0]],
596                            )
597
598                            break
599                    else:
600                        if self._verbose:
601                            print(
602                                f"WARNING!!!!!! Failed {int(len(xtmp[group])/2)} times to find different elements in group '{group}' for swapping at iteration {j}!"
603                            )
604
605                        continue
606                else:
607                    if len(xtmp[group]) == 1:
608                        r = 0.0
609                    elif (xsampling[group] == 0 and len(poptmp[group]) == 0) or len(
610                        xtmp[group]
611                    ) >= maxnel[group]:
612                        r = 1.0
613                    else:
614                        r = uniform(0.0, 1.0)
615
616                    if r < 0.5:
617                        if xsampling[group] == 0:
618                            xtmp[group].append(poptmp[group][new])
619
620                            if xdistinct[group]:
621                                poptmp[group].pop(new)
622                        else:
623                            xtmp[group].append(
624                                uniform(xbounds[group][0], xbounds[group][1])
625                            )
626
627                        if xsort[group]:
628                            xtmp[group].sort()
629                    else:
630                        if xsampling[group] == 0 and xdistinct[group]:
631                            poptmp[group].append(xtmp[group][old])
632
633                        xtmp[group].pop(old)
634
635                gamma = 1.0
636
637                args = ""
638
639                for group in groups:
640                    args += f"{group} = {xtmp[group]}, "
641
642                ftmp = eval(f"list(func({args}))")
643
644                for k in range(len(ftmp)):
645                    if ftmp[k] < fcurr[k]:
646                        pmax = p = 1.0
647                    else:
648                        p = exp(-(ftmp[k] - fcurr[k]) / (temp * weight[k]))
649
650                        if pmax < p:
651                            pmax = p
652
653                    gamma *= p
654
655                gamma = (1.0 - self._alpha) * gamma + self._alpha * pmax
656
657                if gamma == 1.0 or uniform(0.0, 1.0) < gamma:
658                    if xsampling[group] == 0 and new is not None:
659                        lstep[group] = new
660
661                    fcurr = ftmp.copy()
662                    xcurr = deepcopy(xtmp)
663                    population = deepcopy(poptmp)
664                    naccept += 1
665                    updated = self.__updatearchive(xcurr, fcurr)
666                    nupdated += updated
667
668                    if updated == 1:
669                        narchivereject = 0
670                    else:
671                        narchivereject += 1
672
673                    self.__savecheckpoint(xcurr, fcurr, population)
674                else:
675                    narchivereject += 1
676
677                if self._trackoptprogress:
678                    if len(fcurr) == 1:
679                        self._f.append(fcurr[0])
680                    else:
681                        self._f.append(fcurr)
682
683                if narchivereject >= self._maxarchivereject:
684                    if self._verbose:
685                        print(
686                            f"    Insertion in the archive consecutively rejected {self._maxarchivereject} times!"
687                        )
688                        print(f"    Stoping at iteration {j}...")
689                    else:
690                        print(
691                            "Too many attempts to insert a solution in the archive failed!"
692                        )
693                        print(f"Stopping at temperature: {temp:.6f}")
694
695                    print("------")
696                    print("\n--- THE END ---")
697
698                    self.savex()
699
700                    return
701
702            if self._verbose:
703                if naccept > 0:
704                    print(f"    Number of accepted moves: {naccept}.")
705                    print(f"    Fraction of accepted moves: {naccept/self._niter:.6f}.")
706
707                    if nupdated > 0:
708                        print(f"    Number of archive updates: {nupdated}.")
709                        print(
710                            f"    Fraction of archive updates in accepted moves: {nupdated/naccept:.6f}."
711                        )
712                    else:
713                        print("    No archive update.")
714                else:
715                    print("    No move accepted.")
716
717                print("------")
718
719            if nupdated > 0:
720                self.savex()
721
722        if not self._verbose:
723            print("Maximum number of temperatures reached!")
724            print(f"Stopping at temperature:  {temp:.6f}.")
725            print("------")
726
727        print("\n--- THE END ---")

Performs the optimization of the objective function.

Parameters

func: objective function.

def prune_dominated(self, xset: dict = {}, del_duplicated: bool = False) -> dict: 
729    def prune_dominated(self, xset: dict = {}, del_duplicated: bool = False) -> dict:
730        """
731        Returns a subset of the full or reduced solution archive containing only
732        non-dominated solutions.
733
734        Parameters
735        ----------
736        `xset`: full or reduced solution archive.
737
738        The default is {}, meaning the full solution archive.
739
740        `del_duplicated`: delete a solution if the objective values are strictly
741        equal to the values of a previous solution.
742
743        The default is `False`.
744
745        Returns
746        -------
747        Solution archive with non-dominated solutions.
748        """
749
750        tmpdict: dict = {}
751        tmpdict["Solution"]: list = []
752        tmpdict["Values"]: list = []
753        nl: int
754        ng: int
755        ne: int
756
757        if not bool(xset):
758            xset = self._archive
759        else:
760            if not ("Solution" in xset.keys() and "Values" in xset.keys()):
761                raise MOSAError(
762                    "'Solution' and 'Values' must be present in the dictionary!"
763                )
764            else:
765                if not (
766                    isinstance(xset["Solution"], list)
767                    and isinstance(xset["Values"], list)
768                ):
769                    raise MOSAError("'Solution' and 'Values' must be Python lists!")
770
771        included: list = [True for i in range(len(xset["Values"]))]
772
773        for i in range(len(xset["Values"]) - 1):
774            if not included[i]:
775                continue
776
777            for j in range(i + 1, len(xset["Values"])):
778                if not included[j]:
779                    continue
780
781                nl = ng = ne = 0
782
783                for k in range(len(xset["Values"][i])):
784                    if xset["Values"][i][k] < xset["Values"][j][k]:
785                        nl += 1
786                    elif xset["Values"][i][k] > xset["Values"][j][k]:
787                        ng += 1
788                    else:
789                        ne += 1
790
791                if del_duplicated and ne == len(xset["Values"][i]):
792                    included[j] = False
793                elif nl > 0 and ng == 0:
794                    included[j] = False
795                elif ng > 0 and nl == 0:
796                    included[i] = False
797
798                    break
799
800        for i in range(len(xset["Values"])):
801            if included[i]:
802                tmpdict["Solution"].append(xset["Solution"][i])
803                tmpdict["Values"].append(xset["Values"][i])
804
805        return tmpdict

Returns a subset of the full or reduced solution archive containing only non-dominated solutions.

Parameters

xset: full or reduced solution archive.

The default is {}, meaning the full solution archive.

del_duplicated: delete a solution if the objective values are strictly equal to the values of a previous solution.

The default is False.

Returns

Solution archive with non-dominated solutions.

822        if isinstance(xset, dict):
823            if not bool(xset):
824                xset = self._archive
825        else:
826            raise MOSAError("The solution archive must be provided as a dictionary!")
827
828        if isinstance(archive_file, str):
829            archive_file = archive_file.strip()
830
831            if len(archive_file) == 0:
832                archive_file = self._archive_file
833        else:
834            raise MOSAError("The name of the archive file must be a string!")
835
836        json.dump(xset, open(archive_file, "w"), indent=4)
